author: Jeremy S.

review: Very good device for the money. Probably the best streaming device around, especially in the price range. I do not see the appeal of chrome cast for my purposes (the Fire Stick does support casting too though!), I wanted a stand alone device with a designated remote. It basically turns your TV into a smart TV, but with MUCH better user interface. Our TV does have some smart TV capabilities, but it's tedious to use and cannot utilize all features.Why I only gave it four stars, might be the same reason people give it a full five stars. The UI is very Amazon content centered, many of the menus would be useless without having Amazon Prime, or had purchased some Amazon media. I did end up getting prime, the Fire TV was definitely a factor, and the original prime content, along with some of the HBO shows offered.As for side loading, it is pretty easy, but accessing the content takes a few menu selections (or alternative UI).Sideloading Kodi works well,and an older version of slacker radio works too. I have not experimented with games, I have a different device for gaming.Ultimately this is the best TV media device for the money, it's not complicated, but it can be modified.Sidenote: I have it plugged directly into the TV for charging and it has been completely fine
